div.div:
Note that although factory/services are loaded in runtime, they are generally used only for directives (maybe indirectly), so they are only triggered at this moment.
Ex. ResourceSettingsFactory is instantiatiated (the factory itself) but ResourceSettingsFactory('xxx') is not done until a directive triggers it (directly or through another service/factory)

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; text-align: center;
div.div:
wait until the schema
is got

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 136px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: It could be written as 'if the page needs resources and is not a public page'

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 136px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
Public pages they do not need to use ResourceSettings, ResourceServer, etc...
e.x. the public page of a device gets the url of the device form the url of the browser
